definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to hold/to embrace/to wrap around/to gather around (sb)/to throng/to swarm/to support/Taiwan pr. [yong3]
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: When the bus arrived, the children all piled on it.
sentences.chinese: 汽車一到，孩子們一擁而上。

sentences.english: It's been a buzz of media there hinting someone stole it.
sentences.chinese: 媒體一擁而上，暗示一些人偷了總統的手錶。

sentences.english: The lorry drew up and the waiting people piled on.
sentences.chinese: 卡車停了下來，等候着的人就一擁而上。

sentences.english: The Ewoks overpowered Mace and tied him up to take him back to their village.
sentences.chinese: 伊渥克一擁而上把梅斯綁了起來，擡回了村子。
